place.name: COPPENHALL
place.gazetteerText: COPPENHALL, a chapelry in Penkridge parish, Staffordshire; near the Birmingham and Stafford railway, 3 miles S by W of Stafford. Post town, Dunston, under Stafford. Pop., 88. Houses, 18. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Lichfield. Value, £85. Patron, Lord Hatherton. The church is ancient. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
